Reviews.Title: “mandarins are orange,..”
Reviews.Author: jimmhk
Reviews.Content: this hotel is pretty good, albeit ferociously pricey...my beef with it is that a) noone helped with my bags b) breakfast was included in the price but when I checked in, the lady at reception said it wasnt, so it was only when my PA told me it was a b+b deal that i had breakfast (ie once out of six days), and no offer of credit was made to me on checkout, despite their error. Its well situated, staff are generally friendly, rooms are clean although smallish, but as i said, this is very expensive for what it is- and its no Mandarin Oriental HK!

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: CatandDogBrussels
Reviews.Content: This is really one of the best hotels in the world but one would expect no less from the Mandarin chain. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, the staff attentive but not obsequious and the atmosphere charming. The bar is vibrant but can get very crowded and busy. My only criticism was the breakfast. There is no buffet so, if you want a cooked breakfast you have to order from the menu which offers you considerably less choice.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: jim m
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice, the spa relaxing and the location was excellent but what really makes this a 5-star hotel is the service. Everyone from housekeeping and room service to the front desk and concierge showed professionalism and a real desire to be helpful. The only drawback was that our bed was a little soft for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: M L
Reviews.Content: First time in ages that I've stayed in a hotel where the service was truly faultless. lots of people remembering your name. Real smiles not plastic ones. Nice rooms. Great food and unlike many hotels not overpriced if anything it appeared under priced. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Special treatment is the standard”
Reviews.Author: Laurie M
Reviews.Content: When I called MO in Boston and told the front desk I would have a late arrival from California (11PM), she graciously asked if there was anything she could do upon my arrival. Jokingly, I said â€œyes, I would love some room service - 2 scoops ice cream. MO is know for bringing each guest their yummy tea. To my surprise, and delight, the kitchen staff sent not just the tea, however brought me THREE scoops of ice cream with a flower on the tray and a big welcoming smile on behalf of the server and the staff!! I was so blown away because my conversation with the front desk had been over a week before my arrival! I continue to tell this story, and most of all, I continue to get that special attention throughout during my frequent returns to Boston. Sincerely, Laurie M San Diego, Ca

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a princess”
Reviews.Author: Lily B
Reviews.Content: After spending some time looking for a place to live in Boston I decided to treat myself. I also loved the atmosphere of welcoming as soon as you arrive, the front desk and doorman and all the staff. I throughly enjoyed my experience , my room, the spa and the location. So glad I treated myself ! I love hotels where you feel something when you walk in the lobby and not just have a room. So few places realize what a little consistent friendliness can do for a hotel . They have it right!

Reviews.Title: “The Spa was Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ExtremePickyTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. To be fair I don't love oriental decor. The bellman and front desk were friendly and made you feel welcome immediately. All the staff we encountered were wonderful. My husband and I went to celebrate an evening away without our little ones. The location is perfect. You can walk to shops and restaurants, they are just outside the hotel. We had room service for dinner which was spectacular. The food was delicious and our server was extremely pleasant. The spa is the best Boston has to offer. We arrived an hour before our treatment and got to enjoy the vitality pool, rain shower and steam room separately. I was so relaxed before I even began my 80-minute massage. I highly recommend this spa even if your looking to go for the day. We will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel and great value for this level of hotel”
Reviews.Author: ValVil
Reviews.Content: Our recent trips to Boston included stays at Marriott, Hilton, Westin and Hyatt hotels and we decided to aim a little higher this time. Taking advantage of weekend "3 for 2" rates, we chose Mandarin Oriental, having never stayed at the Boston location even though we have stayed at Mandarins in other locations. The hotel did not disappoint. The rooms are modern and cozy, the location is excellent if you want access to restaurants and shopping without going outside in the Winter....and if you do want to go outside, Newbury Street is just around the corner with more restaurants and shops. Service is top quality, as good as we would expect from a hotel of this level. The free Mercedes pick up and drop off is not quite as convenient due to the requirement that it is booked in advance, can only go a maximum of two miles and only in 1/2 hour increments, but who can really complain about free Mercedes service, even if it requires a little schedule adjustment? It really is a nice touch that we appreciated. The staff is amazingly well selected and trained, including front desk staff, room service, housekeeping and concierge, all of which we utilized.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place For Comfort and Style”
Reviews.Author: Tovah N
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Mandarin Oriental this last weekend in January. The service is impeccable. The staff went out of their way to be accommodating. From the front desk, to the bellmen, to the concierge, to the spa staff, to the restaurant manager. We had a great, relaxing time, which was exactly what we needed. I would recommend the Boston Mandarin Oriental highly, to anyone that is considering staying there. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely one of the best experiences”
Reviews.Author: ADK2I
Reviews.Content: Everything about the stay was absolutely perfect. Hotel staff was super courteous and helpful in every regard! Will definitely look to stay at at a MO on our next trip. Location is great as well to walk around Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: AmanJunkieBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a regular room over a long weekend. It was a great base given its proximity to Newbury Street, the Prudential and Copley shopping malls, and the Boston Common. The staff were terrific and always welcoming. The restaurant and bar were warm with good drinks and food. The rooms were very comfortable for two and it was a nice romantic base for couples. I had a car with me, and the valet service was quick and responsive. I would highly recommend the MO versus the other options in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelTheWorldOv
Reviews.Content: Such excellent service at this hotel! We really enjoyed our elegant room with a wonderful deep tub, separate shower and makeup area. The only complaint is that our hot water didn't work unless we ran it for 10 min....Our complementary Mandarin Tea Service was a nice touch! We liked that the mall was connected to our hotel so that we didn't have to venture out in the the cold for a little shopping. Definitely would go back anytime:)

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Escape from the Bustle of the City”
Reviews.Author: LEllen12
Reviews.Content: I don't normally stay at such an upscale hotel. I honestly feel that it isn't worth the money to go to such an expensive hotel. It is a lovely hotel and atmosphere but not so lovely that it is double the price of most nice hotels. Everything extra has a cost. There was not free wifi or coffee in the lobby or any of the services that our complimentary at so many lower end hotels. The room was extremely quiet with lots of space and the bathroom was just beautiful. The faucets were all like fountains. We had room service bring my coffee in the morning and they followed our instructions perfectly. I wanted the coffee left outside my door so as not to wake me if I happen to be able to sleep later than expected. The hotel has a free shuttle but we did not book it in advance so it wasn't available to us. The location is excellent and close to great shopping. If you are looking for a quiet, expensive get away, this will be a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental Boston”
Reviews.Author: Linergan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental on Boylston Street over new year 2011/2012 as it was a friends 40th birthday and she naturally wanted to do something special. New Year there was great fun although we both were suffering from jet lag and our partners were betting on whether we would actually be awake to see in 2012!! You cannot say anything bad about the hotel, reception of staff was excellent, room was fantastic, the bar areas were lovely. It was so very expensive to eat and drink there though. We therefore did not have breakfast there as we didn't think that it would be value for money, we did drink in the bar but not too many times. We have stayed in some brilliant hotels around the world but never with this chain so it was a first for us all. We did have a problem with our "do not disturb" light on the door which meant that our room wasn't seerviced by the time we came back in the evening, but after we informed them of this, our room was cleaned straightaway and hotel manager said that they would check the fault. We also had a problem with the lighting system in that we couldn't switch on the side lights in the bathroom at night without switching on the whole room and there was nothing in the hotel services book to tell you how to operate them etc. We mentioned this on our critique when we got home and had an email back straightaway saying that they would attend to this aspect and thanked us for bringing it to their attention. I would most definitely recommend the hotel, but beware of the price of everything from the spa ($350 for a massage) to the bar and also the taxes that get added to your bill, nearly $90 on each days stay which meant that our room rates were nearly $700 and $600 respectively. The problem is that when you book a hotel in the States you always know that there will be additional taxes but not how much. We should also mention that it is in a great location on Boylston and within in easy walking distance of Fanueil Hall and Cheers etc. Overall we did not think that we had value for money despite how nice it was and how nice the staff were but if you are looking for somewhere special then I don't think you could find a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BT1005
Reviews.Content: I stay here about once a month. Great service, great restaurants, spacious and well appointed rooms. I work out of the Pru when I am in Boston, and the hotel is connected through the mall. It could not be more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetterandfoodie
Reviews.Content: Spent the New Year here. Check in was a little awkward and not as friendly as you would expect from the Mandarin- it must be the northeast attitude thing that is absent once you go west or to Europe. Anyhow, the room was relatively big and the bathroom was very nice. Service other than the reception staff was always friendly and welcoming. The location is great since it is connected to the Prudential center which then connects to Copley, so if you like to shop, then this is the hotel to stay at. Also, a block away from Newbury, which is also a great place to walk, shop, and dine. Spa is also great, so if you have time, definitely make an appointment to get pampered. Fitness center is a little small, but has enough to get a full workout in.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYC102005
Reviews.Content: Beautiful spacious room, great service and amazing spa. Expensive, but worth the splurge. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Gitano
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. I found it easiest to park at the Prudential center. All staff quite nice. Bar was good. Room super quiet with excellent maid service. Heating/cooling in the room off a bit - perhaps I should have said something and they may have fixed it. Alternated OK , then cold. Price is the big downer. Hard to spend $400 per nice, and that was a special rate for a conference. Good for a splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Great room + Spa access = wonderful”
Reviews.Author: emfunk26
Reviews.Content: Not only does the Mandarin offer great service and great rooms, a rental gives you access to their spa on the 2nd or 3rd floor. There is an amazing jacuzzi and a hightech shower. It was so relaxing. And the spa was so clean and well kept. I was very impressed and already have a second massage booked. The restaurant had a great food. The bar was a little snobby for my taste. But the hotel is centrally located so you have many food & bar options to choose from if you prefer to walk around Boston. Celebs are also known to stay there. I saw Derek Jeter at the bar the night I stayed. Didn't say hi though; loyalty to the Soxs but still, cool to see a celebrity staying at the same hotel I was. Means Jeter has good taste :) Though very pricy, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: GlobetroterCostaRica
Reviews.Content: During my last stay in Boston at the middle of this month I have had to chance to stay in this hotel twice within 10 days. From the start with the reservation to the last day check out both stays were perfect in all aspects. What stood out most of all: The willingness to serve and make you as guest feels welcome and at home at all times. The service in all outlets (Bar, Restaurant, Room Service and Housekeeping) has been extremely well executed, friendly, always with a smile and proper timing and correct by all means. I was upgraded to a Suite for the first 3 nights of my stay and spend the returning night in a normal guest room; both rooms were nicely decorated and well appointed, room amenities are of excellent quality. I have not had the chance to use their Spa, however was told the Spa is of high Standard and Great Service Quality. The location of the hotel is perfect, you are in the middle of it all in down town Boston. I am looking forward to my return in December and can only highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again...”
Reviews.Author: Olguita_A
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay at the Charles Hotel in Cambridge which we like the most in Boston. Unfortunately for us, this time we were not able to get a room there booked and had to try something new. Mandarin Oriental is ranked #1 among Boston's hotels on TA, the location is perfect, the name of the hotel speaks for itself. However, our stay was a major disappointment. First, good things. Both restaurants there are very nice, the food and ambiance are great. I highly recommend them, since you don't have to stay at the hotel to try their food. Again, the location is super convenient, adjusted to the Prudential Center and withing walking distance to almost everything. But this is pretty much it. Now ugly stuff. It looks like they simply do not treat all their clients equally. First time I experienced that when I had my luxury mani/pedi at their spa. My therapist (her name was Brandie) was totally inattentive and kind of ignored me during the entire procedure. Well, I don't like super chatty therapists alright. However, why wouldn't she at least give a try to be nice and courteous with her first-time client? I paid $200 for my visit for God's sake, so I'm fully entitled to get the right attitude! The funniest thing is that they had another client at the salon at the same time. The lady was apparently their old client and a generous tipper, so both her therapist and Brandie were super friendly with her, talking to her only and laughing. I felt almost invisible and it was pretty much humiliating. Last thing I must say about my spa experience, it was definitely NOT my best mani/pedi. What I finally got for my fingers and toes, haven't cost $200 at all. Another odd thing about this hotel: they do not provide you with a key from minibar! When we called a concierge, he promised to get us one right up, however, we never got it. Fortunately we didn't really want to use minibar but still, it was a very weird thing. Overall, it seems that the staff there is not properly trained. They pretend they would do anything for you but in fact, you don't get what you paid for. For example, I dined in my room once. I was asked when they should have picked up the trail and dirty plates. I told them I was leaving around 9 pm. They said, ok, we'll clean everything up after you leave. However, when I was back to my room (10:30 pm) the trail was still in there. I called housekeeping and they assured me they would send someone upstairs right away. I left my room again and was back around 2 am. The trail was still there! Now I had to call them again and they finally cleaned everything up. But the ugliest thing happened after the check-out. Our flight back was at 8 pm, so we decided to leave our luggage at the hotel and pick it up on our way to the airport. We had 4 pieces of luggage. When we came back, it turned out they LOST two of our suitcases! We had a taxi waiting (which is not free, by the way) and a plane to catch. However, they couldn't find our luggage for a half an hour at least. A bellboy who was supposed to handle this, was extremely rude and unprofessional!!! Unfortunately, I didn't catch his name, so I can't complain to his supervisors. The front desk staff kept apologizing while their co-workers were looking for my luggage but they sounded irritated and didn't even make an eye contact with me. Finally they found our suitcases but it cost us a lot of stress. I thought they would at least offer to pay for my taxi (a half an hour of waiting!) but they didn't. It occurs to me they behaved the way they did because I look very young and am not pushy enough but too polite. Therefore I wasn't taken seriously. I supposed they would act differently should my husband be present there at that time. I find it totally unacceptable and unprofessional. The hotel is very expensive and some respect must have been included in the rate I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Top class 5 star hotel in Brilliant location for shopping.”
Reviews.Author: Motorsportenthuisias
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on several occasions and while the hotel is slightly distant (10 min in taxi) from the banking and business area it is otherwise the best location in Boston. A newly built hotel attached to a huge Prudential shopping mall and one block away from world famous Newbury street. Public areas pristine. Rooms are among the best I have stayed in. Up there with 4 Seasons and Peninsula. One minor moan, why do I have to pay for wifi at these rates?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: PRproChicago
Reviews.Content: Ask for a room on a higher floor that overlooks Boylston. The neighborhood view is fantastic. Rooms are pretty but a bit small. Bathroom however is a different story -- great size and absolutely luxurious. Hotel vibe was busy but relaxing at the same time. Definitely a respite from a busy trip to Boston. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great service, terrific location...but”
Reviews.Author: lsacpa
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely nothing negative that any sane human being could say about this hotel. It is in a great location, the staff is beyond accomodating, the services are impeccable, the room is spectacular with every amenity you could need down to the umbrella in the closet for those rainy Boston days. So where is the "but"? $600+ per night when all I really need is a clean room and bath, quality staff and $300 less per night. It was a great stay as it was for business and not out of my pocket. Otherwise.....

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: molar67
Reviews.Content: We staid twice at the Mandarin Oriental Boston: an entire week in June and one night in July. The first stay was in one of the basic rooms (506) and is nothing to write home about. A well-equipped room, though poorly lit, reasonably sized and with a good bed. The AC was quite noisy. Internet access is an extra $14/day. Laundry was ineffective, breakfast slow... Our second visit was quite different: a slightly larger room facing the Back Bay (815). Much much nicer: quiet, nice bath, well lit and with windows that open. Breakfast service was perfect and the staff in general was simply incredible in trying to make us feel welcome. So my advice is definitely to book one of the larger rooms. The Mandarin Oriental is in my opinion the best hotel in Boston at the time of writing.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: jledesma
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental in Boston was simply superb - excellent accomodations, classy amenities, very friendly staff, and great service! Will surely stay there again on my next trip to Boston...

Reviews.Title: “what a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: emgarb
Reviews.Content: First time at the mandarin oriental and the place is magnificent - the location is perfect; the staff is friendly and helpful; the spa was exceptional and there is not one thing I can think of that needs improvement! Although it was quite expensive, for a special occasion this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Service Experts”
Reviews.Author: clyons24542001
Reviews.Content: I travel to Boston frequently for business and return to the Mandarin Oriental every time. The MO has a clear understanding of how to deliver top notch service and quality. The rooms are all modern and elegantly appointed. The restaurant and bar are fantastic. Very lively atmosphere and many locals stopping in for afterwork cocktails. The SPA is refined and very relaxing atmosphere. The concierge staff here can handle any request from having a custom suit made to standard reservations anywhere in town. This particular property is convienently located with private access to a very nice and large mall behind the property. You need not even venture outdoors to access the indoor mall. Many restaurants and fine shopping, everything you could possibly need. The Mandarin Oriental is one of the priciest hotels you'll find but all things considered, well worth the additional expense. There IS no other hotel in Boston that compares.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MicheleB52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful and the customer service is top notch! We stayed in Boston for my Birthday weekend to see Harry Connick Jr. at the Colonial Theater. The hotel is in a great location and they went above and beyond to make sure I had a great birthday. The Spa is wonderful and the Prudential Center Shopping Mall is attached to the hotel for easy shopping. We enjoyed the weather, shopping, brunch at Stephanie's on Newbuy, Lobster rolls at Legal Sea Food and walking the Freedom Trail. Boston is clean and the people are friendly, a beautiful place to visit!

Reviews.Title: “This must be the way to live”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Travels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a company meeting so I didn't get to take advantage of all the spa and leisure items and I'm a local in Boston so I won't comment on the tourism aspects. This is the nicest hotel I've ever stayed at, end of story. The staff is wonderful and the rooms are incredible. Giant shower, awesome bath tub. Great closet with the right amount of room for my stuff. GIANT flat screen TV. They even have a special blend of tea and fruit plate sent to your room when you check in. Toiletries are great, bed is SUPER comfortable. The only snags I ran into where with the dry cleaning. I had some items sent down for pressing and asked for them to be returned by 6:30 AM. I had to call down and then wait for nearly 20 minutes until they were brought up and that made me a bit nervous as I had a presentation to run. Also the internet access would not allow me to remote into my company's server (via Windows Remote on Exchange server which is an extremely common way companies give access to their employees while out of the office.) Even after calling my own support people, it looks like the Mandarin blocks certain ports on their firewall. So if you are a business traveler, be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Updated Report”
Reviews.Author: Ravellodreams
Reviews.Content: If I didn't know better, I'd say that hotel management read my previous review, or perhaps they are tracking repeat guests and making an extra effort. All of the kinks were worked out and we had a wonderful stay. During dinner at Osana, the hotel manager approached our table and invited us to a kitchen tour, which was very impressive. The Mandarin is now our hotel of choice in Boston, first because of its great location, and second, because it is an extremely comfortable and relaxing place to stay for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Modern Technology”
Reviews.Author: Cinderella_Dearest
Reviews.Content: Good stay across the board. Everyone called me by name from the doorman to the concierge to the housekeeprs, which is very nice. Responses were prompt to requests. Suite was spacious with a flat screen tv in the living room as well as the bedroom. Technology for the lighting and drapery systems is great. Bed was unfortunately lumpy and too soft - ended up with a backache every morning. It appeared to be an old mattress - how this is possible in a 3 year old hotel I don't know - but the mattress corners were flattened when I pulled the sheets off to see what kind of mattress it was. And gross - there were old dried bloodstains on the mattress pad. Ugh. That's unacceptable in a hotel of this caliber. Hopefully they will replace the matress and the mattress pad with new ones immediately. Very generous array of amenities in the bathrooms. Room service food was very good for breakfast and lunch, and delivered promptly. We were on the 8th floor with a nice view. A/C unfortunately smells very stale - perhaps they did not spend the NECESSARY money to invest in having a top-of-the-line hospital grade/allergy system and filters for every floor, which is the only downside of this convenient centrally located hotel. They need to do something about this! They had an organic lavendar scent at night given at turndown - and even that did not help. Nor should it be necessary. The rooms should smell clean and fresh because the air is 100% oxygen, clean and fresh and completely recycled 8 times an hour. A hotel room smelling strongly for three days/nights like the recycled inside of a stuffy airplane is unpleasant. On the good side, they are also adjacent to a fabulous, enormous indoor upscale mall. Also, If you ask in the morning, often the complimentary beautiful hotel car can take you to your destination within several miles of the hotel. Otherwise, cabs are easy to get.

Reviews.Title: “Probably BostonÂ´s best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YoshiDus
Reviews.Content: First of all I have to mention that this was our second stay at the Mandarin Oriental Boston. Our first experience was somewhat "mixed" so we were courious about this second stay but in the end never regreted the decision. We were fortunate to stay 7 nights during early May and really enjoyed our stay from the arrival until the departure. Since we are frequent visitors to Boston as well as New England we had stayed in almost all 4 and 5* hotels in Boston and I have to say that the Mandarin Oriental Boston is probably BostonÂ´s best hotel. The location on Boylston Street close to the Prudential Center and Mall as well as Newbury Street is absolute perfect. Especially during rainy or snowy weather. You will be able to exit the Hotel directly to the Mall without getting wet. During sunny weather all the nice shops and restaurants are only a stone throw away. Our favorite seafood-restaurant Atlantic Fish is right above the street from the Mandarin Oriental Boston so after dinner you literay just have to fall in your bed. Service at the MOBOS was at its best. We were always smiled at and greeted by name and everybody was super friendly and welcoming. We had booked the lowest room category or Lifestyle rooms on the 4th floor, but personally we liked this room much better the the Deluxe room category we previous had stayed in. Lifestyle rooms have a hardwood floor as well as a day bed below the window. Absolute fantastic rooms in terms of size, cleanliness and and equipment. Twice daily housekeeping made our room always look and feel like brand new. in regards of sleep quality I have to admit that I had the best sleep for weeks during this stay. Beds with Frette linen are like heaven and the sound proof windows guarantee almost no noise from busy Bolyston street. Really amazing are the Concierges Correy and David who were extremley helpfull with almost all reasonable and unreasonable requests. Also a nice touch is the courtesy Mercedes Benz limousine service within the Boston area. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would absolute recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Theofania
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fabulous and while expensive, well worth it. The only negative is that they charge for wifi. In this day and age, why would you nickel and dime at such a high end hotel? Nevertheless, here are the stand outs: Location, luxurious, delicious truffle fries at the bar downstairs, excellent housekeeping, courteous and friendly staff, and heavenly spa. The weather outside was unseasonably cold and rainy but I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. Will be returning when in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Upholding the brand's reputation in style!”
Reviews.Author: DeemarieSingapore
Reviews.Content: Having enjoyed the unparalleled Mandarin Hotels in 4 other countries in Asia, I was a bit skeptical as to how the brand would translate in the US. I was more than pleasantly surprised that they have somehow managed to continue the magic--right down to the ultra comfy beds and top quality linens. Well done on every imagineable level !

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: UrquhartHK
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in the Boston Harbor, but thought I would try the MO. The location is very central, though not perhaps as useful as the 4 Seasons or as 'scenic' as the Harbor. Its well appointed and the room was large, quiet (despite location) and the service was excellent. The restaurant was up to usual MO standards. I didn't use the spa but seemed an excellent set up. All in all an excellent hotel. The only quibbles I have are that I think I prefer the BHH for location. And no MO ever seems to be as good as the HK parent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkshoes518
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the hotel, it seems as though you are the only guest in the entire place! The staff is very accommodating and they take care of you as if you are royalty. The rooms were very comfortable, although I must say that bathroom set up was a bit unusual. The SPA was incredible! Every little thing is thought of and then some more. Great stay, would certainly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Service excellence, quiet sophisticated and understated luxury”
Reviews.Author: DrDiscerningHotel
Reviews.Content: No better in Boston for those who shun Americana and loud obtrusive overfamiliar staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Boston hotel. Typical Mandarin.”
Reviews.Author: cwgriz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one-night business meeting. Room was very nice. New, clean, etc. Great location in Boston. Used the fitness center, and I was surprised that it was not nicer. It was fine, but I expected it to be very high end â€“ spa like. It did have everything I needed, although it was quite crowded by the time I left at 7:30am. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: bostongal_11
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin's service, style, comfort and attention to detail is superlative. My room was a double double as I was traveling with colleagues and we could not have been treated better - when we asked for extra pillows, they were not only brought to the room within 5 minutes but we had three different choices. Asana's food was modern and delicious and the drinks were creative and wonderful. Although I didn't have time to book a spa service, I did have an hour to myself to relax at the spa and it is the best in Boston for tranquility, amenities and lovely staff. The experience shower and vitality pool are delightful and unexpected. The business center is quiet and stocked with fresh fruit and icy cold water - a nice surprise on a busy day. I cannot praise the hotel more highly (and I know my hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Abdullakhalid
Reviews.Content: The moment I walked in through the door you will feel welcomed and at home. The staff is very friendly like I have never seen starting from the door man to the bellhop who escorts you to the room. I stayed in the executive king room. It was very spacious and had all the facilities you need, a 40 inch television with all the channels you need, a sofa as well as a desk space. High speed internet was available for a reasonable price. The bed was very comfortable it was large and they had the most comfortable sheets I've seen thus far in a hotel. The bathroom was very large, it had a shower and a bathtub I was very pleased. the service was excellent they came everyday to clean the room perfectly and in the evening to turn the bed cover to be ready for when you sleep. The restaurant Asana also had a friendly staff and it was designed in a very trendy and stylish way just like their delicious cuisine. Their spa looked very nice and I am very sad that I didn't have the time to go there. finally the location was superb you can access the prudential center mall straight from the elevator and it had all the shops you need. supermarket is 1 block away if you need it as well as the apple store is adjacent to the entrance. Newbury street was 1 minute away which had any shops you need that you couldn't find at the prudential center. The Boston common park is 5 minutes away from you by foot. I'd definitely recommend you to go for a jog / walk along the Charles river its 3-5 minutes away and it has a fabulous view of the river in fall and as well during the winter when its frozen. It has been a wonderful experience for me in Boston and I thank the hotel for making my stay comfortable during those 8 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: pfm81
Reviews.Content: Great new hotel. Located next to prudential, in front of the Apple store. Great staff, rooms and scent throughout the hotel. Would stay here again, however, it is somewhat expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A step or two in service below the Ritz Carlton.”
Reviews.Author: pkdpwdr
Reviews.Content: I had stayed previously at the Ritz Carton on Avery on four prior occasions and at the advice of a colleague decided to try the Mandarin Oriental on Boylston. Upon arriving, the doorman, John was chatting it up with a cabbie and didn't respond to my arrival until I was pulling my luggage our of the trunk. Maybe it was because I was driving a Nissan Murano rental versus a Mercedes 450. On check in I was offered evening tea delivered to the room, which I accepted. It never arrived. Had to call in-room dining. After gratuity was paid for bags, doorman handed cart off to bell staff to deliver to the room, requiring gratuity to be paid again. Felt like a conscious double dip on the tip. At about 10:45 pm I ordered a Turkey club with Avocado as described in the in-room dining menu. Sandwich arrived with no Avocado, and enough mayonnaise to take up the same space. Light switches in the room were wired to some sort of master making it very challenging to turn off all lights or to turn them on. Seemed a constant battle between wall switches and fixture switches to receive lighting levels desired. Should be dimmers for bedside lamps, but they are either on or off with no adjustment for brightness. The alarm clock was some little lightweight plastic gadget that would fall on it's side with the lightest touch. I could not determine how to change from 24-hour time to 12-hour time, so it remained 12 hours off the correct time for the duration of my stay. I used my cell phone for an alarm. The towels were about Sheraton quality. Nothing soft, rich and luxurious feeling like you'd find at St. Regis or Ritz. No coffee options in room whatsoever. I understand the upsell potential for F&B but sometimes you just want a cup w/o a 15 minute wait. Particularly important for early morning flights before the Starbucks is open. U stayed on the 4th floor, the Spa level with public access. This level requires no special access key for elevator, but my Ving-type room key would not seem to work in the hallway door between the elevator and the guest room. Usually after three careful insertion attempts the lock would finally open. Frustrating, inconvenient, particularly with shopping bags in tow. In the room there were not enough trash cans. One tiny one in the bathroom was all I could find. I did find the in-room dining hostess, Tracy, wonderful, upbeat and friendly. She should go work for the Ritz Carlton. While I'm impressed with Mandarin's mission statement and high-level guest service standards, I'm not sure I'll try Mandarin Oriental again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but had some service issues”
Reviews.Author: YoshiDus
Reviews.Content: We just returend from a 2 night stay at the Mandarin Oriental Boston. Since it was my first time at this hotel, I had very high expectations. Unfortunatley they could not be meet, primarily because of some inconsistent service. We arrived from NYC, where we had a really wonderfull stay at The Peninsula, so our expectations might had been to high for the MOBOS. We arrived at 2 PM, was room was not ready. Waited in the lobby for 45 minutes, but nothing happend. Showed up at the front desk again and it was obvious from the clerks reaction that he had forgotten to keep up on us and our room. Nevertheless lobby and location is excellent to hang around for some time. Rooms are really nice and I would rate them as one of Bostons best. We had a deluxe room on the 5th floor overlooking Boylston Street. Our room was perfectly clean, but already showed minor signs of deterioration. There were multiple dents in the furniture as well as a huge hole in the wallpaper. More annoying was the breakfast at Asana. They overcharged us on both mornings and reacted amateurish and offended to my complaint. Majority of the staff was also only mildly friendly and acted synthetically. Nice plus is the free hotel car and the great location in the heart of Back Bay. Nevertheless the value-for-money ratio is somewhat less than perfect.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite now in Boston...”
Reviews.Author: scoi00
Reviews.Content: I used to go to the Four Seasons in Boston that actually I believe still has the best location. I don't know why now when I go to a town I always check first if there is a Mandarin and only then if there is a FS. There is nothing wrong with the FS , actually the service is outstanding . The difference perhaps is that the Mandarin's are more detail oriented and more "european", somehow more modern . I like to have a separate shower and not have to use the bathtub to take a shower . I like that the hotels rooms look all so different. When I go in a FS the rooms in the one of Mexico City are similar to the one in Austin and even in Boston. Perhaps two outstanding FS are the one in Milan and New York .. Anyway I can only recommend this Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: lighthouselover66
Reviews.Content: The standard amenities t hat come with the room and the services provided by friendly staff, made this one of the best overall hotel experiences ever! Thanks to all for making our special occassion even more special!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Some Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: baci2003
Reviews.Content: The Location is amazing-best place in Boston Great Restaurants within the Hotel--all have excellent food!! The Spa is amazing--a must!!! Rooms are very nice--comfortable--well appointed. Rain shower are fantastic but read below. However, there were several service issues that you would not expect at a Mandarin Oriental. When we checked in the front desk person asked us if we would like to have a welcome drink sent to our room as is done at MO hotels. They forgot to send it. When I told the staff that we are going out and that they had forgotten to send the drinks he apologized and promised to send it in the evening. They forgot again. That evening when I took a shower I noticed the shower pressure was very weak. I asked if someone could take a look at the shower. Engineering came up right away. They recommended that we change our room since it will take a while to fix. We stopped by the front desk to check about moving our room and they wanted to put us in a smaller room on a lower floor. So we decided to stay in our original room since engineering made a temporary fix. Two days later the handle to our shower fell off in the shower while housekeeping was cleaning the room. Instead of having it fixed they simply left the handle on the bathroom counter. We had also gone out and purchased sparking water bottles for each of our bedsides. Housekeeping would take both bottles and put them up on the bar each day rather than leaving them on each side of the bed. So we would not know which bottle was who's. This is a great hotel and we would definitely go back. Hopefully the service hiccups will be fixed next time.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AlexMontreal
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to write a few lines here after staying at the Mandarin Oriental in Boston during labor day weekend. I drove down to Boston from Montreal with a few friends to see a Red Sox ball game. We only stayed for one night, but I wish we had stayed longer. This hotel is totally awesome. Granted, it was built just 2 years ago I'm told, so it's still very new and modern looking, nothing is out of place, no scratches, paint chips, marks on the carpet, etc. But regardless, they know how to take care of their guests. From the time you pull up in front with your car, the doormen & bellhops are super friendly & polite. Same for the staff at reception. The room was truly perfect. From a huge, super luxurious bathroom, to a very big and spacious room, to ultra comfortable beds, and of course tons of TV channels (so we could see all the game highlights when we can back from the game!), this hotel has it all. Oh and the turn-down service at night was pretty classy too. The bar downstairs is modern and was pretty happening, even on a Sunday night. I've been to Boston several times in the past few years, and this was the best hotel stay I've had. I'll certainly look to stay here again next time, and would recommend it to anyone, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in perfect part of town”
Reviews.Author: bcs1309
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental is a wonderful and luxurious hotel and couldn't be in a better part of town. Rooms are great, bathroom very spacious with good amenities. Staff is very well trained, friendly and attentive. All the extras in the hotel are very pricy and WiFi is an extra USD 15 per day. But the Apple Store is on the other side of the street. Hotel is next to Prudential Center (go up there at night to the bar for a drink with a view) and very close to shops and restaurants on Newbury Street. Overall: worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, understated luxury”
Reviews.Author: USBrits
Reviews.Content: Terrific service, quiet, luxurious - plus a yoga mat in the room, which was an admittedly unused nice touch, but just goes to show the extra level of thought that has gone into the product. We ate at a board meeting in the restaurant and the food was great. Gym is small, but adequate. Beds were very comfortable. Room amenities were well thought out.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Luxurious Boston Hotel - Absolutely Dreamy”
Reviews.Author: kjohnso3
Reviews.Content: I've been booking hotels in Boston for the past 10 years for overnight stays and conferences. This hotel is the most luxurious. The overnight rooms are incredible, spotless, spacious and windows open to get some fresh air!. Colleagues raved about the rooms. The bathrooms are not only huge but are extraordinarily beautiful in every detail. You will find the staff are the most professional and friendly and are eager to help with any needs. The restaurant was exceptional. The meeting space is perfect for a medium-sized group and I absolutely loved the ballroom. It's going to be hard to beat this 5* gem! I would highly recommend this hotel for stays and conferences!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: letsgoawaykids
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a girlie weekend with my sister for shopping and sightseeing. The hotel is very modern and everything is 'big' in that American way - big furniture, rooms, art, & smiles. The staff were truly lovely, helpfull and attentive without being overly so. They booked restaurants and cars for us and advised on good shopping and the best tours (Gotta do the Duck Tour) Rooms were a little dark but large and luxurious with ipod dock and great bathrooms. Breakfast delicious and cooked to order with fruit juice/smoothie of the day .Didnt eat in the restaurant but it seemed very popular - when we mentioned to locals where we were staying they all mentioned it. The bar was lovely. Very Smart with attentive and intelligent staff who always had a warm welcome. Very busy and smart Friday and Saturday nights. A great, genuine quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous spa, sleep there, the beds suck! Bathroom was hairy.”
Reviews.Author: ItalianInspiration
Reviews.Content: We travel all over the world and landed here, under much ado about some things. The spa is world class, perfect in every way from the moment you arrive. It felt like a private spa just for me. Moving on to the room, maid service was non existent and really poor quality. we had to ask to get the room made up, ask for towels, ask for a newspaper-which never came, and on and on that went. It wasn't the cleanest or nicest room. The bathroom was very pretty though, inspite of someone else's hairs in the john and tub. After a long journey, my husband and I got into the Frette sheeted bed and rolled into the middle of the bed in Room 710. We were so uncomfortable, it was possibly one of the worst beds we have ever slept in. The staff flipped the bed and put something incredibly hard underneath it to correct the problem. So my husband and I then rolled into the middle followed by an abrupt stop onto a rock. Not acceptable at 600 dollars a night. So we spoke to the Front Desk upon check out. The pretentious help told us that he liked a firm mattress himself, thanks for sharing! Then he said that they couldn't change all the beds and basically couldn't have cared less. All we wanted was sincerity and acknowledgment, but they give attitude. The help in the breakfast dining run the other way and disappear, even though there was one other table eating breakfast. Our food took 45 minutes to come out, and it was cold, and not very good. the oatmeal was a solid lump! It's beakfast, it's expensive and it sucked. We did have great room service, which consisted of the best warm brownie with mouse on top I have ever had in my life. I would go there just for the brownie, then leave, do not sleep in this hotel! Or go to the spa, the furniture is supremely comfortable and relaxing. ps-they charge 15 dollars for internet service!!!!!! It's not included in the 600 dollar a night fee. not worth it- Westin's heavenly bed even beats this hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic contemporary hotel in great back bay location”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler13
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Boston is a fantastic hotel. 1 block away from Newbury and there are several great restaurants very close. Hotel is incredibly clean and comfortable. I didn't like the pillows my first night, but they offered to bring several different types. Bathroom was huge and spotless. Staff very friendly and not pretentious like staff at The Four Seasons hotels. Great spa/exercise room. Wouid absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service makes all the difference.”
Reviews.Author: LLCoug
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in the Back Bay area of Boston. The trip was for work but our spouses attened. My husband and I stayed in an Executive King room and it was wonderful. While a hotel room is a hotel room is a hotel room....it was extremely clean and the bed linens and pillows were exceptional. We had a great view over Boyleston street and the windows truly are soundproof....we couldn't hear any traffic at all. But what makes this hotel worth the high pricetag is the service. The employees go out of their way to make your stay the best hotel experience ever....and they succeeded. We would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: wbere
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in in my life. From the minute I made my reservation, I was treated like royalty. I was in Boston to run the Marathon and decided to splurge a little to reward myself for my hard work. And the hotel was 1 block from the finish line, one from the expo, close to the bus I needed to take to the start, next to a T stop, and had good Italian restaurants (and the whole city) nearby, so the location was perfect. The staff is uniformly wonderful. The front desk even gave me and several guests admission to a private party overlooking the race course, and allowed me a very late check out. The room was gorgeous, the bed divine. The deep soaking tub and bathroom were fantastic. The walk in closet was huge. The room was extremely quiet. I ordered breakfast and a wake up call at 4:30 a.m. the morning of the race and both were performed exactly at that moment. The bell man helped me chase down a cab at a different hotel because Boylston was still closed due to the race. It's that kind of place. You MUST stay here if you are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Lured by a lovely property into a soulless room”
Reviews.Author: jdfinvenice
Reviews.Content: In a city filled with not a few luxury (and legendary) hotel names, we gave the MO a try, given it's relatively recent opening, and our experiences with other MO properties across the globe. Frankly, I was startled by the lack of attention to detail. The room rate was wrong at check in; the room felt sterile, dull, and easily copied in any corporate hotel in any major city in the US; lamps were broken; and, frankly, we feel it's a bad sign when the best part of the room is the bathroom. I don't sleep in a tub, and I expect a room to feel both welcoming and unique. Having stayed at a number of other top notch Boston properties (Four Seasons, Beacon XV, the Ritz) this felt like a glorified Hyatt. To be fair, the staff is superb (I would expect nothing less); there are an awful lot of channels in the cable selection; and once the lights were out the bed is incredibly comfortable- but that does not make this property unique. Given the price- I expect to be wowed. I was simply warmed- and swiftly interested in moving to one of my previous, favorite properties.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Ritz or the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Taroramen
Reviews.Content: We traveled on the AMX Platinum card and received an upgrade . . . to a room right next to the service entrance on the floor. After a few hours of jumping every time the service door slamming shut we requested a room change and were put in a very nice room . . . except the water in the shower turned on in the middle of the night for no apparent reason. Management apologized profusely, but did nothing to alter our bill. This year we had an minor problem at the Boston Four Seasons and they gave us the night for free! We have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental New York and San Francisco and had a wonderful experience each time so it made our Boston experience that much more disappointing and surprising. For my money (and it is my money) I would choose the Ritz or the Four Seasons any day.

Reviews.Title: “Pure enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: NewportGuyNewportRI
Reviews.Content: From the bellman at the door to David at concierge to our gorgeous room for Valentine's weekend we had a marvelous stay. All the attention to details and friendly staff were very much appreciated by us- two inn owners from New England. The restaurant "Asana" within the hotel, was very good for breakfast- part of our weekend package. We know how difficult it is to run a small property but this hotel is managed like a well oiled machine. Keep up the great work- we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Mandarin Won Me Over!”
Reviews.Author: JimInNaples
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for a long weekend on 12/18 and can't wait to return! The staff are incredible, they remember your name, are extremely outgoing, courteous and friendly and seem genuinely concerned about your stay. The room was outstanding! The bath was probably the most luxurious hotel bath I've seen-miles of granite, rainhead showers etc., etc. The bar off the lobby is the new "hot" place to be, and the restaurants are great! In addition, the hotel provided chauffered car service at our disposal. While I'm normally a die-hard fan of the Ritz Carlton, unfortunately the remaining one in Boston is in what I would describe as a seedy area, The MO is in a spectacular locale, with everything you would want at your doorstep-in addition, it has interior access to the Prudential Center Mall/Arcade offering nearly 100 shops/restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “MARVELOUS”
Reviews.Author: S_oPaulo_BrazilVera
Reviews.Content: Everyone nice and polite. Beautiful new hotel, wonderful location. The restaurant is marvelous, makes you want to eat there all the time. Beautiful rooms and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and chic”
Reviews.Author: BCNY
Reviews.Content: Visiting my niece at university I decided to try the new Mandarin Oriental. This was my first stay at a Mandarin and I was very pleased. I also booked a room for her and my sister. Having booked through AMEX Centurion Travel, they upgraded both our rooms and gave us all the extras that come along with it. The style of the hotel was very contemporary but still warm. The location is fantastic for shopping and restaurants and fairly near her school (B.U.). Also made a lot of use of the hotel's Mercedes, which drove us several places nearby. This is a really nice touch for a hotel of this level. The room I was given was very roomy and had an incredible bathroom. I had a nice view over Boylston Street but it was very quiet despite all the activity below. Had a great time the first night in the bar and had delicious appetizers. Breakfast was also quite good each morning. Having stayed in other hotels in Boston, the Mandarin offers a nice change from the Four Seasons, Taj and Ritz - while all very nice, are a bit tired and unexciting. I highly recommend the spa as well. Had the whole Men's side to myself so enjoyed the offerings before a great massage. Bostonians, I would recommend using the spa on a regular basis! Overall a great intro to the Mandarin Oriental brand for me. Next up is to try one of their resorts!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelerkl
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin is a wonderful high end property. The hotel is centrally located to great shopping (one block from Newbury Street), restaurants and tourist attractions. The spa is amazing, it's very large, has several treatment rooms and all the nice amenities you would want during your appointment. Take advantage of the huge steam room with the high tech lighting. The hotel rooms are well appointed and the bathroom is very spacious with nice bath products. Hotel bar and restaurant were both very good. Bar is busy on Friday nights. Service and staff were top notch. Only negative would be the high cost of the room, but on the other hand, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, near perfect”
Reviews.Author: Canberra_Traveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were lucky enough to stay a week at the hotel which opened late last year. The location in Back Bay cannot be beaten - near restaurants, Newbury Street, Copley Square, Prudential Shopping Centre and at least 2 metro stations. It was a 10 minute walk to Fenway Park to watch a Red Sox game and a 100 metre walk to Commonwealth Avenue - a beautiful tree lined residential street. Everything about the interior states quality and style. Staff were welcoming and had very high standards of customer service. Our Back Bay room on the 5th floor was spacious, well equipped and had a pleasant view over Boylston Street (not the River). The bedding was luxurious and extremely comfortable. The lighting system was a little complex - in fact we never worked it out but the bathroom was excellent - large, sparkling with masses of towels, quality fittings and toiletries. Asana Restaurant was excellent - breakfast and service were wonderful - not quite as good at dinner but innovative menus and impressive nevertheless. The concierge service was outstanding - they organised restaurants, a car to take us there, Red Sox tickets, hairdressing appointments - and were an excellent source of knowledge and advice. If I had to find a weakness it would be housekeeping - just a few minor blips such as knocking when the "Do not disturb" sign is on. At check out the bill was spot on. I guess it's the usual Mandarin Oriental standard and it'd be hard to do better in Boston. We really enjoyed our stay. We were lucky to get an opening promotional rate from Amex.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JimDublin57
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel for any purpose - business or leisure. It is a new building (only 10 months old at time of writing) and the amenities, decor and overall cleanliness are faultless. Service is probably the best I have experienced (undoubtedly drawing from the 'oriental' background of this hotel group) and very friendly, right from the doorman meeting the taxi to the housekeeping staff. And nothing was too much trouble for the front desk / concierge. The rooms we had were very large with every possible amenity and extremely comfortable beds. As a hotel guest, you can use the vitality suite in the spa and you really should - it is the most relaxing environment with huge whirlpool, steam room and multi-programme shower (not shower as in bathroom - you have to try this to understand!). The bar is great - they can do any drink you can think of and the bar staff are very friendly and really knowledgeable about the drinks they have. Finally, the restaurant (Asana) is well worth a visit with top notch food and an Asian twist (getting away from standard steakhouse menu - although they do a lovely filet mignon and an outstanding Kobe Beef). The location of the hotel could not be better - on Boylston St, surrounded by other great restaurants, yards from Newbury St, very close to Copley Place; strolling to Faneuil Hall takes only 30 to 40 minutes if you are inclined but taxis are lined up outside and there is a complimentary limousine to bring you anywhere within a couple of miles of the hotel. Overall, not cheap, but this is one place where you really do get what you pay for in the best possible way.

Reviews.Title: “the most beautiful hotel room...”
Reviews.Author: ledox
Reviews.Content: The mandarin Hotel is really nice and the room is awesome!!! the bathroom is breathtaking by the size, its really huge. i had the luck to stay there for 1 night, if money is not a problem for you pick that hotel its the best!!! its well located too, right on Boylston street and close to Newbury street. i give a A+++ for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Perfect hotel in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: TxTravelPro
Reviews.Content: Stayed Tues-Fri in this wonderful hotel and did not want to go home! Arrived from the airport in a cab and when I got out the bellman asked my name. He them proceeded to know why I was there and how long I was staying. Crazy... I guess I mentioned it to someone. Impressive! Check in took just a few minutes at 530pm and the front desk clerk was a doll. A bellman took me to my room and ran through the highlights. It's a BIG room with a full closet, sitting area, big bath and all the extras. I am very picky about cleanliness and this hotel was spotless. The fridge is not one of those electronic ones and he told me I was welcome to use it for my special drinks. There is a soaking tub and rain shower and they provide you with Gilchrist and Soames bath salts, which is nice. One of my favs! The biggest surprise was when I sat on the bed. OMG... this is some bed! THE most comfy bed I have EVER been in. It is like a cloud. I must have told everyone about those beds, all week! I was lucky to have lunch in the restaurant, Asana. I ate light but started with the tomato/watermelon soup with crab and avocado puree. I'll admit I was a bit worried but it was really delicious... and a brave menu item! For dessert I was convinced to try the Egg White Island (I think that's the name) and it was truly different. A box made of soft, jiggly meringue filled with a tangy fresh banana shake. It was awesome but way too big for one person! I definitely recommend the restaurant. Very inventive! The whole stay was nice and smooth... the location is just perfect. Downstairs from the lobby is a big mall, across the street is Anthropologie :) and 1 block over is Trader Joes. Add to that the charm and allure of Newbury street, which is pretty much across the street. The concierge mapped out a great 3 mile run for me. All in all I cannot wait to get back. The hotel would make a perfect 2nd residence... well, I can dream, right :)

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Buns4vs
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by name and personally escorted to our rooms which were simply the best we have ever encountered. Rooms were spacious, well appointed and in impeccable decorative order. We could not get over how great the staff were there, always greeting us by name and it seemed that nothing was ever too much trouble for them. As other reviewers have mentioned, the noise from the Bar in the evening when local office workers congregate for drinks is in stark contrast to the serenity encountered in the rest of the Hotel, but in no way changed our view of the Hotel. We will certainly visit again if the price is right

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Spa Getaway”
Reviews.Author: pickles1107
Reviews.Content: Once we arrived, we were greeted by 4 different individuals from the time we stepped out of the cab until we got to the front desk, as one would expect at a 5 star hotel. Congratulations were offered at check in as I noted it was our honeymoon when making the reservation. I wish I had asked for an upgrade at checkin, but I forgot. We stayed at 3 hotels in Boston during our honeymoon and this was the only one we weren't offered an upgrade at. Hotel Marlowe and Nine Zero (both Kimptons) win in this regard. We were assigned room 508, a standard King room, were escorted to the elevator, and left to find the room ourselves. I was not bothered by the fact that we were not shown to the room. Initial impressions of the room were very good, but the more we were there, the less impressed we were...more on that in a minute. Within 5 minutes, our bags arrived and the bellhop showed us some features of the room. Another 3 minutes, another knock on the door. They brought up our complimentary beverages which were offered at checkin and some chocolate covered strawberries. How nice of them! We cleared out a space in the mini fridge and put them away for later. Now for the room itself: THE GOOD- Nice King sized bed with Frette linens, a sectional couch, large (~46") Phillips HDTV (that actually had HD channels) above a large dresser, a separate desk area with stationary, notepad, scissors, paper clips, etc. The bathroom was phenomenal with a separate standup shower with rain shower head and handheld head, a separate toilet room, and a nice soaking tub with bath salts. Top notch hardware for the faucets and dimmer lights finished it off. THE SHORTCOMINGS- Upon closer inspection, there were several details that were lacking in these rooms, including: 1) the lack of doorstops for the doors. All it takes is one careless guests to open the bathroom door to fast and you've got a 4 inch hole in the drywall. The left closet door smashed into the door frame of the bedroom when it was 70% open, and judging by the marks and dents in the frame, I was not the first guest to discover this. 2) According to the website, each guest room has a walk-in closet. Now come on...no way ours could be considered such. Maybe if you removed all the hangers and ducked below the shelves someone could technically fit in there, but let's call an apple an apple. 3) To the left of the dresser in plain view against the wall were remnants of peanuts. We looked behind the dresser and were disgusted to find other trash and food bits behind there. 4) For only being 8 months old, the dresser furniture was somewhat misshapen. Both doors to the dresser were warped. The left one was difficult to close without some force because of clearance issues, and the right one when closed and touching at the bottom produced a half inch gap near the top. Strange for brand new furniture. 5) Dust had collected and gone uncleaned on the bathroom light fixture lamps. 6) Maybe it was operator error, but the lights in our room had three master switches, one near the door, and one on each side of the bed. Obviously this is so you don't have to go around turning off every lamp before bed...just crawl in and flip the switch. However, without the master switch on, the bathroom lights won't fire on either, thus you are left with a strange predicament should you have to go potty in the middle of the night...either fumble around the bathroom in the dark or blanket the whole room in 60 watt light. Luckily, this situation did not present itself during our one night stay. These issues may or may not be confined to room 508, but in any case this is not what one would expect from a luxury hotel. The next day we woke up early to get some breakfast at Asana (the MO's restaurant) which was included in the room rate. The included continental breakfast consisted of 4 pastries and cost $21. With tip it would have cost us over $50 if not included...Totally not worth it. At 10 o'clock my wife was scheduled for her two hour spa experience, which she enjoyed immensely. This was also included in the room package price. With the massage and breakfast costs added separately, the room basically costs us $10 for the night. In the spa, there are things called experience showers where you can select between four different experiences (rainforest thunderstorm, arctic blast, and two others) and the nozzles/heads output the water based on each setting. There are also lighting and sound effects. Interesting concept which I did not try out myself...opted for the demonstration only. About a month before checkin, I emailed the concierge regarding our upcoming stay. I inquired about using the house car to get from the Mandarin to the Nine Zero Hotel upon checkout. One thing I found out is that they are not very quick in responding to emails, at least the guy I was dealing with. You could usually count on a reply in three business days. He informed me that they normally don't reserve the car and it is on a first come basis, but they could make exception for the occasion. Fast forward to our actual stay when I went to double check that we had the car reserved. Imagine my surprise when the concierge tersely told me it was not reserved, nor do they reserve the car. I informed him that I had been in email contact with another concierge agent and was told otherwise. Anyways, it all worked out as the car was free for that time, but they really need to get on the same page. Once we were there, we used the concierge several times for various recommendations, and they were all a pleasure to deal with, so it seems like an isolated incident. Overall, in our situation and for the package price of $372 that we paid, it was a fantastic value when the massage with gratuity would have been over $300 anyways, but if I were just staying there on the rack-rate for room only, no way could I justify that when we stayed at the Nine Zero for $200 less. Service was great and friendly (save the one concierge), and the bellmen greeted us by name as we came and went, but all the other shortcomings would not justify the going rates here. If the massage and breakfast were not included, I would probably rate this review as a 3 star experience based on value alone. This was our first stay at a true 5-star hotel, and after this, I'm not rushing to come back.

Reviews.Title: “MO at its best!”
Reviews.Author: travluxery
Reviews.Content: Perfect experience! MO at its best, everything top-notch, f & b experience spectacular with the typical world-class MO service. Four Seasons and Ritz should be worried....

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service! Looking forward to our next stay at a Mandarin.”
Reviews.Author: archerychick
Reviews.Content: My husband & I traveled last minute from California with our six month old for a family funeral in New Hampshire. We required specific amenities in our room to meet the needs of our baby, which included a crib, and all our needs were meet with great care, promptness and courtesy. Johann and his staff were so attentive to even the smallest details and we cannot say enough great things about their efforts to make us feel welcome. The baby crib was filled with cute baby products, which made our little guy feel right at home. After a long trip across country we were well cared for the second the valet opened our car door. The room was well appointed and comfortable. We ordered room service for breakfast and dinner, and both the meals and the service, were outstanding. We highly recommend the scallops and the clam chowder (when in Rome). My husband called ahead to have a flower arraignment set up for me in our room, and both the flowers and the arraignment were classic and beautiful. We look forward to our next visit at the Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service at the MO”
Reviews.Author: Pretzellogix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love the MO group, so we took the opportunity to check out their new Boston property on a recent trip to Boston for her birthday. The hotel is in a great location, right next to all the shopping on Newbury, Boylston, and the Prudential center, in addition there are plenty of great restaurants within walking distance. The service, which really sets MO apart from other high end chains, was phenomenal from the moment we walked into the hotel. Friendly and helpful valet, doormen, and front desk staff. As soon as we got to our room, room service brought the customary welcome pot of green tea, and to our surprise, a bottle of champagne accompanied by a beautiful and delicious birthday cake for my wife (I had mentioned that it was her birthday on the reservation). The room was nicely sized, with an incredibly comfortable bed dressed in Ploh pillows and Frette linens. The bathroom was also great, with a huge soaking tub, nice shower, and neat overall design. We were on the top floor with Boylston street views which amounted to a nice view and very little noise. The only disappointment was a lack of any kind of radio or stereo. The only music was on the LCD Tv, which had very tinny speakers. The alarm clock was just a little travel alarm... As for the decor, I prefer the styling at the New York and Miami Mandarins, but that could just be a personal preference. We did not eat at the restaurant, but the breakfast brought to our room was right on time, delicious, and my 3-minute soft boiled eggs were perfect. The rest of the hotel is clean, quiet, and very comfortable (it is brand new). We were especially impressed with the fitness center and spa. The fitness center was small, but all the equipment was top of the line. The spa was... exceptional. From the moment we got there, they took our shoes and gave us spa sandals, and we were shown the quartz crystal steam room, the digital experience shower, the vitality pool, and the relaxation room. Frette bathrobes, big towels, plenty of bottled water and fresh fruit... I must have spent several hours there, just relaxing. I would come back for the spa alone, but fortunately, everything else was top notch. This place is definitely a little nicer than the Ritz, with a much, much better location.

Reviews.Title: “One of Boston's Best”
Reviews.Author: JoeNH
Reviews.Content: Very cordial reception upon arriving at the hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was ready upon arrival. Excellent amenities and very comfortable and quiet room. Lunch and breakfast in their main dining room called Asana were both fantastic. Afternoon cocktails and nibbles at MO (the bar) were terrific. Several spa treatments pretty much brought our stress levels down to zero. If you go you have to experience this spa. Service was out of this world. Wife needed dress pants hemmed and seamstress arrived in room within 15 minutes. Thirty minutes later pants were back, perfectly hemmed and she wore them that evening. Other things requested and immediately taken care of were soft pillows and video/audio cable to connect my laptop the flat screen TV in the room. The only down side to staying at the Mandarin was that after three days we had to leave. We can't wait to go back for another long weekend in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: DEfamilyman
Reviews.Content: What a GREAT hotel. I have stayed in many hotels but this was a 5 star experience. I was very impressed from beginning to end. As I made my through the hotel, the hallways, the common areas, I kept noting how clean, and quiet the hotel was. The room was large, CLEAN and quiet. Great bathroom, great shower (how rare is that in a city hotel?). The staff was very polite and gracious. I was there for a meeting, the facilities were fine, comfortable, made for a nice meeting. The hotel bar and restaurant were good. The location was easy walking distance from Back Bay Amtrak station. I made dinner reservations at a local restaurant and got a free ride in a Mercedes sedan without asking for it. Highly recommended, I will certainly go back if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin is a Five Star Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: BrooklineMama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into the Mandarin with our 4-month old infant for two nights during Thanksgiving weekend to be close to family staying nearby. We live in the area, so we are very familiar with Boston and all of the high-end accommodations here. Overall, I was very impressed. First of all, the hotel is really beautiful. Design-wise, it is not too distinctive - it feels like a luxury hotel - but they have all the amenities you'd expect and the finishes are top of the line. The room was elegant, but not exactly spacious. The bed was really comfortable, and the bathroom was gorgeous. We really appreciated that there were no pay-per-view movies - instead the hotel will bring you a Blu-ray DVD player and a list of DVDs to choose from - for free. Their selection was very current and diverse enough. The service was remarkable. Everyone was friendly, phone calls were answered promptly, and special requests were honored quickly. When we asked for our DVD player, an engineer was at our door within 5 minutes. While he was connecting the cables, the phone in our room rang - the operator was apologizing that it had taken the engineer so long to get to us. We had to laugh! The same attentiveness and speed applied to room service. The orders were filled quickly and arrived within 5 minutes of the promised time. Again, all special requests were handled perfectly. Most impressive was the hotel's attitude towards children. When we checked in, we found that our room had been completely childproofed ahead of our arrival. All outlets were covered and every sharp corner was padded with foam. The crib we had requested was waiting for us, with a box of baby amenities tucked inside, including diapers, wipes, soap, rubber duckies and a teddy bear. It was pretty amazing. I am so happy for families planning to travel to Boston that there is a new option in town. I love The Four Seasons hotel dearly - and they are similarly kid-friendly over there- but this is in a slightly different neighborhood, and the indoor connection to the shopping mecca contained within the Prudential Center and Copley Place makes this a perfect home base for exploring Boston during the colder months.

Reviews.Title: “More Hype than Substance”
Reviews.Author: Slotguy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Mandarin Oriental New York last year, I was interested enough in the new Boston property to book an overnight stay, even though we live in Greater Boston. Perhaps if I hadn't followed all the written articles about it, I would have had fewer expectations. Many things were nice - the greeting by valet and staff person in the lobby, the quickness of the guest elevators, and the overall quietness of the hotel. My disappointments are subjective, of course. The "less than great" experiences include: - Arriving to valet curbside, right on Boylston Street amid a multitude of pedestrians. For a property of this caliber, I think they missed a golden opportunity to begin the "Mandarin Experience" by not having a covered porte cochere, which would remove arriving patrons from the constant hustle of Boyston Street. Curbside valet? At these prices? - The room decor was nice but easily duplicated elsewhere in Boston and in many other large American cities. Routine, high-end finish materials, but clearly not distinctive. I could have been in at least 2 other Boston hotels, given the similarity of the rooms. Because the guest room views are of Boylston Street, I thought the interior design would be "wow", in order to make up for the so-so view of Boylston Street businesses. I don't think the Four Seasons has anything to worry about. All things being equal, (and the Mandarin and Four Seasons room rates are right on par with each other), the Four Seasons has it over the Mandarin by virtue of the Public Garden views & infinitely more elegant shops adjacent to it. Do I really want to spend $750.00-plus per night to look out at giant bridal shop display windows and a glowing Apple Store directly across from me?

Reviews.Title: “5 Star All The Way”
Reviews.Author: suzyjacuzzi
Reviews.Content: First review! The Mandarin just opened up a few weeks ago and my husband and I were fortunate enough to spend 1 memorable Saturday night here to celebrate my birthday. This hotel is phenomenal in every way and I would highly recommend it to anyone for a special occasion or romantic getaway! This is definitely the place to stay in Boston for pure indulgence and 5 star service. The lobby is absolutely gorgeous with unique artwork, subtle color hues, and beautiful orchids and plantings. The staff was friendly and efficient without being stuffy or uptight ~ this hotel group prides itself on customer service and it shows. The hotel is in a great location w/ tons of shops, restaurants and tourist attractions close by. The hotel has a brand new Mercedes Benz for guest transportation around the city. Our King room was extremely spacious and tastefully decorated. The room was much larger than a standard hotel room and was outfitted w/ a huge flat screen tv, wetbar, desk, couch and plenty of storage space. The bathroom was enormous with unique lighting, a separate water closet, spectacular rain shower and a very large soaking tub. The bathroom amenities spanned all the way from a nail kit to a loofah ~ the custom shampoo, body wash, conditioner, etc. was better than any hotel I have ever stayed at. Our room had a view overlooking Boylston Street and, to our surprise, was extremely quiet. The bed was amazingly comfortable with "gourmet" sheets and pillows. Turn down service included bottled water, soft music and slippers next to the bed. Staying here was definitely a treat and I envy the people who actually own the residences affiliated with the hotel! The M bar was good for a few (expensive drinks) ~ we did not eat at the restaurant but it was quite busy on a Saturday night. The health club was perfect for a quick workout and was complete w/ state of the art equipment and stretching machines. We were able to peek into the spa which is scheduled to open at the end of October - I'm sure a day at the spa is just as much as a hotel room! It looked incredible. This hotel is a nice addition to Boston! Book it - You won't be disappointed.
